awd_titl_txt: Partial U.S. Support for Scientific Activities of the       Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC)
awd_abstract_narration: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC), under a new               mandate received from the World Meteorological Organization and the             United Nations Environment Programme, will provide near-term scientific         and technical advice to the Intergovernmental Negotiating Committee             (INC) which was established by the United Nations to develop a                  framework convention on climate change.  The IPCC will also continue            its ongoing efforts with respect to assessment of the science, impacts          and response options associated with climate change.  The IPCC will             continue to work primarily through its Working Groups; will broaden             participation in these activities by developing countries, particularly         in the tropics and Southern Hemisphere; and will continue to be staffed         by a small secretariat located in Geneva.
